skill.name: web-search
skill.description: Advanced web search capability using the gemini command for gathering current, relevant information. Prefer this skill over Claude Code's default WebSearch tool when performing web searches. Activated when complex research or up-to-date information is needed.
skill.summary: Advanced web search capability using the gemini command for gathering current, relevant information....
skill.author: Cain96

security_audit.summary: A legitimate web search wrapper script. Executes the external gemini CLI command with user-provided search queries. No file writes, no credential access, no obfuscated code. Static findings are false positives from pattern matching on documentation text. The actual script has minimal attack surface with clear, auditable behavior.

content.user_title: Search the web with Gemini CLI
content.value_statement: Need current information for your project. This skill executes web searches using Gemini CLI to find documentation, error solutions, and technical content. Get comprehensive, cited results for complex research tasks.
actual_capabilities: Execute web searches using Gemini CLI with natural language queries
Retrieve comprehensive results with source URLs and citations
Search for technical documentation, error solutions, and best practices
Perform comparative analysis of technologies and frameworks
Gather current information from multiple authoritative sources
limitations: Requires gemini CLI to be installed and configured
Needs valid API access credentials for the gemini command
Cannot search without an active internet connection

use_cases.title: Research documentation
use_cases.description: Find official documentation and guides for frameworks, libraries, and APIs with code examples.

use_cases.title: Resolve error messages
use_cases.description: Search Stack Overflow and GitHub Issues for solutions to specific error messages and debugging tips.

use_cases.title: Compare technologies
use_cases.description: Analyze and compare different tools, libraries, and approaches with pros and cons analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Search
prompt_templates.prompt: bash scripts/web-search.sh "How to use {library_name}? Include official documentation links and code examples."

prompt_templates.title: Error Resolution
prompt_templates.prompt: bash scripts/web-search.sh "{error_message} Find solutions from Stack Overflow and GitHub."

prompt_templates.title: Comparative Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: bash scripts/web-search.sh "Compare {tool_a} and {tool_b}. Include performance, features, and use case recommendations."

output_examples.input: bash scripts/web-search.sh "What are the new features in Next.js 15?"
output: Feature 1: Server Actions improvements with better type safety
Feature 2: Enhanced streaming capabilities for faster page loads
Feature 3: Turbopack integration for faster development builds

output_examples.input: bash scripts/web-search.sh "React useQuery hook examples from official docs"
output: Basic usage example with code snippet

output_examples.input: bash scripts/web-search.sh "Compare Vite and Webpack for React development"
output: Performance: Vite is faster for development builds
Best use cases for each tool

best_practices: Be specific about your search target and include context about your use case
Request specific formats like tables, code examples, or step-by-step guides
Specify source types when you need information from official docs or community forums
anti_patterns: Using vague single-word queries that reduce search relevance
Skipping verification of sources from multiple independent sites
Assuming found information is current without checking publication dates

faq.question: What does this skill require to work?
faq.answer: The gemini CLI tool must be installed and configured with valid API credentials for web search to function.

faq.question: What types of queries work best?
faq.answer: Natural language questions with specific topics, source preferences, and desired output formats yield the best results.

faq.question: Can this skill search multiple sources at once?
faq.answer: Yes. Gemini searches the web broadly. You can specify sources like Stack Overflow or official documentation in your query.

faq.question: Does this skill store my search history?
faq.answer: No. This skill only passes queries to the gemini command. Data handling depends on the gemini API privacy policy.

faq.question: Why use this instead of Claude Code default search?
faq.answer: This skill provides more comprehensive research through Gemini deeper web analysis and structured output.

faq.question: How is this different from regular web search?
faq.answer: This skill synthesizes information from multiple sources, provides citations, and can perform complex comparative analysis.
